intro: Amorphophallus konkanensis var. kinnerasaniensis, commonly known as the Kinnerasani arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant produces a striking, spadix-like inflorescence that can reach several feet in height. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. Due to its unique morphology and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
